Description: A buffer overflow vulnerability in BMC Control-M/Agent 7.0.00.000 when the On-Do action destination is Mail and the Control-M/Agent is configured to send the email, allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to the configured IP address or SMTP server.
Reasoning: Exploatation occours through the protocol, but donâ€™t exploit the protocol itself. In addition, the implementation of the SMTP protocol includes improper use of a buffer, that leads to a buffer overflow under certain conditions

Description: A user controlled parameter related to SMTP test functionality is not correctly validated making it possible to bypass blocked network recipients.
Reasoning: This cve exploits a flaw in the STMP test functionality. The vulnerability stems from a failure to validate user-controlled input properly within the SMTP test functionality, which is an implementation flaw.

Description: The Internet Mail Service in Exchange Server 5.5 and Exchange 2000 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion) by directly connecting to the SMTP service and sending a certain extended verb request, possibly triggering a buffer overflow in Exchange 2000.
Reasoning: The vulnerability directly affects the operation of the protocol by creating dos.  Implementation flaws leads to improper handling of extended verb requests leads to a buffer overflow in Exchange 2000 and causes memory exhaustion in both Exchange Server 5.5 and Exchange 2000.

Description: McAfee WebShield SMTP 4.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a malformed recipient field.
Reasoning: The vulnerability directly affects the operation of the protocol by creating dos.  The vulnerability origin is malformed recipient field - hence its origin is implementation

Description: sink.c in fetchmail before 6.3.9 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL dereference and application crash) by refusing certain warning messages that are sent over SMTP.
Reasoning: The vulnerability directly affects the operation of the protocol by creating dos. Implementation flaws in sink.c leads the software to false in handeling certain types of STMP messages, creating null pointer.

Description: Format string vulnerability in MemeCode Software i.Scribe 1.88 through 2.00 before Beta9 allows remote SMTP servers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in a server response, which is not properly handled "when displaying the signon message."
Reasoning: The vulnerability uses the protocol itself to cause dos and execute code. Implementation flaws in i.scribe leads to mishandles format string specifiers in SMTP.

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in QK SMTP 3.01 and earlier might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long argument to the RCPT TO command.
Reasoning: The vulnerability is related to SMTP since it uses buffer overflow created there, and changing the protocol execution. The buffer overflow is a reasult of an implementation flaw.

Description: The SMTP service in MailEnable Enterprise 1.04 and earlier and Professional 1.54 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (server crash) via an EHLO command with a Unicode string.
Reasoning: The vulnerability directly affects the operation of the protocol by creating dos. The vulnerability is lead by an implementation flaw where MailEnable fails to correctly process EHLO commands containing Unicode strings.

Description: An issue was discovered in the lettre crate before 0.9.6 for Rust. In an e-mail message body, an attacker can place a . character after two <CR><LF> sequences and then inject arbitrary SMTP commands.
Reasoning: The vulnerability exploit implementation flaw in the parsing of the STMP message to inject SSTMP commands.

Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in iaspam.dll in the SMTP Server in Ipswitch IMail Server 8.01 through 8.11 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a set of four different e-mail messages with a long boundary parameter in a certain malformed Content-Type header line, the string "MIME" by itself on a line in the header, and a long Content-Transfer-Encoding header line.
Reasoning: The vulnerability required the protocol to be used but not exploiting it directly, as it exploits the pswitch IMail Server. An implementation flaw leeds to improper validatiom of the SMTP message.

Description: PGP/MIME encrypted messages injected into a Vaultive O365 (before 4.5.21) frontend via IMAP or SMTP have their Content-Type changed from 'Content-Type: multipart/encrypted; protocol="application/pgp-encrypted"; boundary="abc123abc123"' to 'Content-Type: text/plain' - this results in the encrypted message being structured in such a way that most PGP/MIME-capable mail user agents are unable to decrypt it cleanly. The outcome is that encrypted mail passing through this device does not work (Denial of Service), and a common real-world consequence is a request to resend the mail in the clear (Information Disclosure).
Reasoning: The vulnerability required the protocol to be used but not exploiting it directly, as it exploits the Vaultive O365 .  It results from implementation errors in how Vaultive O365 implements the handling and transformation of PGP/MIME encrypted messages.

Description: Unknown vulnerability in SMTP authentication for MailEnable allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash).
Reasoning: The vilnerability directly involves the SMTP protocol because the vulnerability occurs during the authentication phase of SMTP sessions handled by MailEnable, due to implementation error in it.

Description: Mail in Apple Mac OS X before 10.5, when an IPv6 SMTP server is used, does not properly initialize memory, which might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash), or obtain sensitive information (memory contents) in opportunistic circumstances, by sending an e-mail message.
Reasoning: The vulnerability required the protocol to be used but not exploiting it directly, as it uses implementation flaw that creates memory exploits in MacOS Mail.

Description: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in sendmail 5, as installed on Sun SunOS 4.1.3_U1 and 4.1.4, have unspecified attack vectors and impact.  NOTE: this might overlap CVE-1999-0129.
Reasoning: Sendmail is an STMP server, so since the vulnerability, it must envolve the protocol.

Description: An exploitable command injection vulnerability exists in the web management interface used by the Foscam C1 Indoor HD Camera running application firmware 2.52.2.37. A specially crafted HTTP request can allow for a user to inject arbitrary shell characters during the SMTP configuration tests resulting in command execution
Reasoning: The vulnerability requires the use of SMTP but it does not exploit it directly. The vulnerability stems from improper  validation of the HTTP request - hence its origin is implementation.

Description: Super Mail Transfer Package (SMTP), later called MsgCore, has a memory leak which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by repeating multiple HELO, MAIL FROM, RCPT TO, and DATA commands in the same session.
Reasoning: The vulnerability directly relates to the SMTP protocol as it exploits use some of its commands to create a memory leak. The vulnerability stems from improper  memory management while handeling the SMTP commands  - hence its origin is implementation

Description: In the web management interface in Foscam C1 Indoor HD cameras with application firmware 2.52.2.37, a specially crafted HTTP request can allow for a user to inject arbitrary shell characters during manual network configuration resulting in command injection. An attacker can simply send an HTTP request to the device to trigger this vulnerability.
Reasoning: The vulnerability requires the use of SMTP but it does not exploit it directly. The vulnerability stems from improper  validation of the HTTP request - hence its origin is implementation.

Description: The Receive Service in Websense Email Security before 7.1 does not recognize domain extensions in the blacklist, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and send e-mail messages via an SMTP session.
Reasoning: The vulnerability required the protocol to be used but not exploiting it directly, as it exploits the Receive Service in Websense Email Security. The origin is logic since before versiom 7.1 there was no implementation to recognize domain extensions in the blacklis.

Description: Jenkins Email Extension Plugin 2.72 and 2.73 transmits and displays the SMTP password in plain text as part of the global Jenkins configuration form, potentially resulting in its exposure.
Reasoning: The vilnerability directly involves the SMTP protocol because the vulnerability exploit the structure of the protocol itself (the passwords are being exposed in plain text). It is a logic flaw since an encryption should be implemented.

Description: A user controlled parameter related to SMTP test functionality is not correctly validated making it possible to bypass blocked network recipients.
Reasoning: Buggy implementation,  is dependent on SMTP parameter

Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in iaspam.dll in the SMTP Server in Ipswitch IMail Server 8.01 through 8.11 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a set of four different e-mail messages with a long boundary parameter in a certain malformed Content-Type header line, the string "MIME" by itself on a line in the header, and a long Content-Transfer-Encoding header line.
Reasoning: Buggy implementation,  isn't dependent on SMTP but on HTTP paremeter

Description: A buffer overflow vulnerability in BMC Control-M/Agent 7.0.00.000 when the On-Do action destination is Mail and the Control-M/Agent is configured to send the email, allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to the configured IP address or SMTP server.
Reasoning: Buggy implementation,  isn't dependent on SMTP but on software controlled actions

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in QK SMTP 3.01 and earlier might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long argument to the RCPT TO command.
Reasoning: Buggy implementation, sends malicous SMTP packet

Description: Mail in Apple Mac OS X before 10.5, when an IPv6 SMTP server is used, does not properly initialize memory, which might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash), or obtain sensitive information (memory contents) in opportunistic circumstances, by sending an e-mail message.
Reasoning: Buggy implementation which causes memory exploits, dependent on sending an email message through SMTP

Description: Jenkins Email Extension Plugin 2.72 and 2.73 transmits and displays the SMTP password in plain text as part of the global Jenkins configuration form, potentially resulting in its exposure.
Reasoning: Jenkins leaking plaintext passwords related to smtp does not relate to the actual protocol

Description: cmd5checkpw 0.21 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via an "SMTP AUTH" command with an unknown username.
Reasoning: Handling of SMTP AUTH with malicous credentials takes a long time and as such causes a DOS

Description: A user controlled parameter related to SMTP test functionality is not correctly validated making it possible to add the Carriage Return and Line Feed (CRLF) control characters and include arbitrary SMTP headers in the generated test email.
Reasoning: Mishandling of carrige returns is a implementation bug which is dependent on the SMTP parameter

Description: SurfControl SuperScout Email filter for SMTP 3.5.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a long SMTP (1) HELO or (2) RCPT TO command, possibly due to a buffer overflow.
Reasoning: Handling of SMTP packets with malicous data takes a long time and as such causes a DOS

Description: Curl_smtp_escape_eob in lib/smtp.c in curl 7.54.1 to and including curl 7.60.0 has a heap-based buffer overflow that might be exploitable by an attacker who can control the data that curl transmits over SMTP with certain settings (i.e., use of a nonstandard --limit-rate argument or CURLOPT_BUFFERSIZE value).
Reasoning: Due to buffer overflow relating to SMTP parameters one can achieve denial of service

Description: SMTP service in MailEnable Standard, Professional, and Enterprise before ME-10014 (20060904) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via an SPF lookup for a domain with a large number of records, which triggers a null pointer exception.
Reasoning: DOS due to possible nullpointer-exception has nothing to do with email protocols

Description: The Receive Service in Websense Email Security before 7.1 does not recognize domain extensions in the blacklist, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and send e-mail messages via an SMTP session.
Reasoning: Bypassing checks related to SMTP is an implementation bug

Description: An exploitable command injection vulnerability exists in the web management interface used by the Foscam C1 Indoor HD Camera running application firmware 2.52.2.37. A specially crafted HTTP request can allow for a user to inject arbitrary shell characters during the SMTP configuration tests resulting in command execution
Reasoning: This CVE is using SMTP tests for the exploit but the exploit is  a command injection exploit which has nothing to do with SMTP
